original: KJELLMAN, Walter, överingenjör, Stockholm, f Hälsingborg 29/11 05 av disp W K o Asta Larsson, gm Ruth Lindeman. KTH 28, spec.stud i Erdbaumech v Techn Hoohsch Wien 31—32. Ing v Obras Publicas, Malaga, 30, AB vat.b.byrån 30—36 (bl a v vat.kr.vk i Ryssl), 1:e byråing V o V-styr 36—43. övering o chef f Statens gentekniska inst sed. 44. Geotekn utredn åt många statl o komm myndigh, industrier mfl. FI geotekn o mil patent. Av trycket: Jordarters deformationsegensk (Tekn Tidsk 36), Säkerhetsprobl ur teor o princ synp (IVA handl 40), Hållfasthetsbestämn direkt i marken (IVA handl 43) mfl. 1. pris Polhemspristävl 35, IVA pristävl om utredn av Säkerhetsprobl 39. Hobbies: Tennis, segling.
translated: Kjellman, Walter, chief engineer, Stockholm, born in Hälsingborg on November 29, 1905, son of disp[Walter Kristoffer Kjellman] and Asta Larsson, married Ruth Lindeman. Studied at KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) until 1928, with special studies in Earth Construction Engineering at the Technical University of Vienna from 1931 to 1932. Worked as an engineer at Obras Publicas in Malaga in 1930 and at AB vat.b.byrån from 1930 to 1936 (including work as a water engineering consultant in Russia). Became a senior engineer at V and V-styr from 1936 to 1943. Appointed chief engineer and director of the State Genetic Engineering Institute in 1944. Conducted geological and technical investigations for various government agencies, municipalities, industries, etc. Holds geological and environmental patents. Published works include "Deformation properties of soil" (Tekniska Tidskrift, 1936), "Security problems from theoretical and practical perspectives" (Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences Proceedings, 1940), "Direct determination of soil strength" (Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences Proceedings, 1943), etc. Awarded first prize in the Polhems prize competition in 1935 and participated in the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences competition on security issues investigation in 1939. Hobbies: Tennis, sailing.

awards.name: Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences competition

memberOf.name: Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences
